wikipedia_page.main:
Henry "Harry" Tyrer 
Crosby-born Tyrer has been with Everton since the age of seven.
An athletic, commanding goalkeeper, Tyrer established himself in Everton's Under-18 side in 2018/19 before breaking into David Unsworth's Under-23s the following season.
Boyhood Evertonian Tyrer played 11 of the young Blues' 18 Premier League 2 matches, delivering a series of fine performances before the campaign was halted due to the coronavirus pandemic.
Tyrer's impressive development was underlined when he penned a first professional contract with the Club in January 2020.
The talented stopper was a regular in Everton First-Team training by the end of 2019/20 and he kept a clean sheet for the seniors in a Goodison Park 2020/21 pre-season victory over Preston North End.
Tyrer subsequently featured 15 times in Everton Under-23s' Premier League 2 campaign, recording three shutouts, and featured in seven First-Team matchday squads.
Contracted until: June 2022
